ModuleDescription:
The module covers the principles, technologies and
operational aspects of smart weapon systems e.g. guided
weapons, precision munitions and unmanned vehicles
(UxVs). The interplay of various sub-systems for target
identification & tracking, guidance/navigation, command
and control and their impact on mission effectiveness will
be examined with consideration of counter-measures and
counter-counter-measures. Additional topics include
advanced concepts for autonomy, interoperability and
teaming and cooperation. The course will include case
studies of these weapon systems in actual combat.
Prerequisite:
Basic undergraduate mathematics at the level of
DTS2701 Engineering Mathematics
DTS2703 Probability and Statistics
